response.original_title: Mit L.35 über Berlin und Potsdam
response.overview: The sequence depicts an airship’s journey, starting with its departure from a hangar and people waving on the ground. Inside the commander’s gondola, Commander Hans Flemming and his crew manage the airship. The airship flies over Berlin, showcasing landmarks like the Lustgarten, Royal Palace, Cathedral, Gendarmenmarkt, Leipziger Platz, Potsdamer Platz, Victory Column, Reichstag building, Brandenburg Gate, and Unter den Linden. The engine room and radio operator’s cabin are shown, with technicians performing maintenance and communication tasks. The airship also passes over Potsdam, Sanssouci, and the New Palace. Commander Flemming and his staff plan the route at the chart table. The sequence concludes with the airship’s landing, as technicians operate the engines and ground crew assist. The German Air Force logo marks the end.
response.title: Mit L.35 über Berlin und Potsdam
